title: January 2024
taskDescription: Construct a story, poem, long sentence or short paragraph containing exactly 26 words. Each beginning with a different letter of the alphabet. They can appear in any order. Points will be awarded for writing that makes the most sense, and has a consistent tone, message or story.

submissions.description: "You up? Hear that?" Zzzzzzzz. Rustling - louder. Keep calm. It's approaching quickly. Eyes flicker, brightening darkness. Very worried now. "Xanthe, gosh!" Just my pet snake. "Ouch!"
Baobabs oscillate / Lions congregate / Zebras and xerus quickly flee / Vultures gnaw / Eagles soar / Whilst impalas hide under trees / Kudus prance / Young jackals dance / Rainbow nation melodies
"A big cute dog eating frozen grapes has indigestion. Jumping, knowing later more nibbles. Ooooh pies. Quickly, Ralph slurps thick udon, vigorously wolfs xouba. Yummmm, zucchini"

Atlas: born somewhat god-like, verily condemned forever lost everything yet ultimately discovered the world. xylemic, he pushed mantle outwards; quivering, knackered nevertheless zealously, receiving judicious injury.

Our carriage materialises yielding Katharine's sterile zone. "Government plants alight here", Xavier, Victor leave. Bygone names, unregistered individuals; filling their recurring journeys quota. Does Wapping exist?

Personally, I just love the new vegan meat and dairy substitutes; 'Zuasages', 'Xggs', 'Yheese', 'Qutter', radically flavourful but without oppressive guilt. Cheese hurts udders. Knowledge emancipates!
"Barbadian Whistling frogs zealously demand ladies' courtship sunset until morning, jumping keenly and reciting xylophonic poems over everything. However, trumpeting in vain yields no quick gain."
